problem.markdown:
>>Which machine is the bottleneck?<< [[ \(M_1\) \(M_2\) \(M_3\) (\(M_4\)) \(M_5\) \(M_6\) ]]
[Explanation] Recall that \(e=\frac{r}{r+p}\) Then, \(e_i = 0.952, e_3 = 0.870, e_4 = 0.833, and e_5 = 0.870\). Because \(e_4\) is the smallest, \(M_4\) is the bottleneck. [Explanation]
>>Which buffer will have the largest inventory after a long time? << [[ \(B_1\) (\(B_2\)) \(B_3\) \(B_4\) \(B_5\) ]]
[Explanation] The rate of increase is largest for \(B_2 = 0.952 - 0.870 = .082\), and thus \(B_2\) will have the largest inventory after a long time. [Explanation]
